questions.question: Which statement correctly describes complementary angles?

answerOptions.text: Two angles whose measures add to 90°.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct. Complementary angles form a right angle when combined.

answerOptions.text: Two angles that share a common side and vertex.
answerOptions.rationale: This defines adjacent angles.

answerOptions.text: Two angles that are equal in measure.
answerOptions.rationale: Equal angles are congruent, not necessarily complementary.

questions.question: Which statement correctly describes supplementary angles?

answerOptions.text: Two angles whose measures add to 180°.

questions.question: If a car travels 180 miles in 3 hours, what is its average speed in miles per hour?
questions.rationale: To find the unit rate (speed), divide the distance by the time: 180 miles / 3 hours = 60 miles per hour.

questions.question: A map has a scale of 1 inch : 50 miles. If two cities are 3.5 inches apart on the map, how far apart are they in reality?
questions.rationale: Multiply the map distance by the scale factor: 3.5 inches * 50 miles/inch = 175 miles.
